text: I now give the floor to his Excellency
Damiano belifi
chair of the delegation of San Marino
Your Excellence
Mr President excellencies on behalf of
the government of the Republic of San
Marina would like to congratulate his
excellencies Dennis Francis on his
elections as president of the 78th
session of the United Nations General
Assembly and to wish him a fruitful work
I would also like to extend my special
thanks to Secretary General Antonio
Gutierrez for his energy and
determination in leading the United
Nations in this difficult and
challenging times Mr President the
coming years will be crucial not only
for our future but for that of
generations to come the promises of the
2030 agenda are in danger despite years
of sustainable development gains
millions of people
have fallen into poverty and anger and
malnutrition are becoming more pervasive
we are concerned by the multiple
interlinked crises that are pushing our
world over the brink especially
developing countries the crisis of
climate change
biodiversity loss and pollution
migration and force displacement the
cost of living crisis the water food
financial and energy crisis are
threatening our planet and people and
derailing progress on the sustainable
development goals
moreover the intensification of
conflicts in many parts of the world
together with natural disasters which
have become more frequent and intense
are causing human suffering and
compromising the implementation of the
2030 agenda
Mr President the increasingly evident
interrelationships among Global
challenges I like the need for member
states today more than ever to work
together to overcome difficulties no
individual State even the most powerful
or technologically advanced has the
capacity to face the global challenges
on its own San Marino reaffirms its
commitment to multilateralism with
United Nations at its Center and in
particular in the framework of the
general assembly as the most
representative body of the United
Nations on account of its deeply
Democratic nature Universal
participation and Undisputed legitimacy
we need to strengthen our commitment to
implement existing agreements such as
the 2030 sustainable development agenda
the Paris agreement on climate change
the biodiversity convention
international law treaties and to make
the necessary reforms to the system
we need to revitalize United Nations by
reinvigorating the multilateralism if we
want to pursue credible solutions to the
global challenges to this end it is
essential to rebuild trust in the
potential of the organization in its
leadership and most of all trust between
its members and all the stakeholders
moreover the global governance must
become more inclusive and accountable to
be effective by providing more space for
the participation of civil society and
private sector it must ensure
sustainable Finance by catalyzing a new
generation of public and private
investment in global Goods but also by
strengthening the Global Financial
Safety Net in order to make it possible
for member states to access to
International funding during times of
Crisis reforms must remain at the center
of our action because they are crucial
to future world stability and
maintenance of International Peace and
security
in this regard San Marino follow with
particular interest the security Council
reform as we have stated on previous
occasions our country believes that
intergovernmental negotiations favor the
search for an agreement based on a broad
and strong political consensus able to
reflect the interest of all negotiating
groups San Marino calls for a reform
that makes the council more democratic
transparent efficient and accountable
this goal can be achieved only through a
continuous dialogue among member states
and the awareness that overcoming the
respective initial position is essential
to negotiate the broadest agreement
possible
Mr President we are facing difficult
times with an unprecedented level of
violence Mass atrocities and
displacement San Marino is deeply
concerned about the number and the scale
of armed conflict across the globe which
cause immense suffering to millions of
civilians
submarine is also very concerned about
the alarming increase of dangerous
nuclear rhetoric and nuclear treats
which reinforce the image of a dark
future instead of a sustainable one and
use or treat of use of nuclear weapons
is responsible and totally unacceptable
Unfortunately today the risk of a
nuclear weapons use either deliberately
or by accident desire then at any time
since the Cold War nuclear weapons we
use
would cause massive death and
destruction it would create catastrophic
and prolonged consequences on human
health and well-being as well as on the
on the environment
San Marino affirms its commitment for a
world free of nuclear weapons and
attached Street importance to the
Milestone treaty on the prohibition of
nuclear weapons that currently has
reached more than 90 States signatories
Mr President war of aggression against
Ukraine broad dramatic consequences for
the civilian population including
civilian death the destruction of a
vital infrastructure is a massive
displacement
San Marino condemns the Russian
aggression against Ukraine and support
Ukraine's Independence sovereignty and
territorial Integrity within its
International recognized border at the
same time San Marino welcomed all
International efforts for a
comprehensive just a lasting peace in
Ukraine in line
with the U.N chartered the resolution of
the general assembly and international
law
San Marino supports the obligation under
humanitarian law such as the convention
on the prevention and Punishment of the
crime of genocide the Rome stated and
the Geneva conventions
San Marino reaffirms its full commitment
to the international criminal courts
whose work is crucial in the fight
against impunity for genocide and crimes
against humanity and it represents one
of the core elements for the
implementation of the responsibility to
protect the ICC through its work Fosters
accountability and thus promotes
prevention and Reconciliation
Mr President armed conflicts around the
globe have Dramatical impact the lives
of millions of civilians and resulted
into continued and massive displacement
submarine is alarmed by the
unprecedented food and nutrition crisis
affecting hundreds of millions of people
around the world the protection of
Civilian infrastructures is key to
ensure food Security in time of conflict
one infrastructures and tools essential
to the survival of Civilian are damaged
or destroyed
food production and distribution water
delivery sanitation energy provision and
Healthcare can all be disrupted San
Marino calls on all parties to implement
Security Council resolution 2417 which
condemns the use of starvation of
civilians as a method of warfare as well
as the unlawful denial of humanitarian
access furthermore San Marino supports
Security Council resolution 2573 which
condemns attacks against critical
civilian infrastructures indispensable
for their survival
Mr President
is particularly concerned about the high
number of gray violation against
children reported also this year in the
secretary General's report armed
conflicts continue to devastate
children's lives and to compromise their
fundamental rights we are witnessing an
increase in attacks on schools and
hospital this is unacceptable San Marino
firmly condemns attacks on schools and
hospitals as well as their use for
military purposes Healthcare and
education are fundamental children's
right that must be always preserved we
reiterate our support for the safe
School declaration education declaration
educational facilities should be a safe
place for all children student and
teacher
we are also concerned for the
substantial increase in the Recruitment
and use of child soldiers we call on all
member state to ratify the optional
protocol to the convention on the rights
of the child on the involvement of
children in armed conflict we also
encourage all parties to support other
important tools such as the Paris
principle and commitments and the
Vancouver principles
San Marino supports the work of the
special representative for children and
armed conflict and offer office and
welcomes the new action plans and
commitments that have been signed or
that are in progress
Mr President the increasing number of
conflict shows how diplomacy mediation
and conflict prevention are tools to be
strengthened for a sustainable piece
today more than ever political Solutions
inclusive peace processes
a conflict prevention strategy and a
strong faith in multilateralism are
required today we Face several and
interrelated security challenges access
to natural resource is one of them while
climate change is increasing in both an
existential treat and a key driver of
complete the link between the climate
emergency and security issues is
self-evident and it needs to be
addressed within a security Council in
order to respond to the needs of the
poorest and most vulnerable communities
the effect of climate change are causing
sufferance
to the most vulnerable communities
especially to small island developing
State the least developed countries and
those affected by conflict rising sea
levels poor precipitation record
temperatures exacerbate the risk of
instability by reducing Harvest
displacing communities and destroying
infrastructures climate policies in
green transitions offer opportunities
for reducing the devastating effect of
climate change it is imperative to
address the challenges posed by climate
change through Ambitions mitigation
adaptation and implementation of the
loss and damage agenda and an adequate
climate Finance agenda if we fail that
we live devastating effects for the
planet as well as development
development and human rights
Mr President without immediate
acceleration of sdg's implementation our
world will endure new periods of Crisis
and uncertainty the recent sdg Summit
represent a chance to scale up efforts
to achieve the 2030 agenda and the Addis
Ababa action agenda including true
development cooperation sdg investment
enhancing macroeconomic policy
cooperation and implementing action to
accelerate sustainable development in
particular in support of developing
countries
San Marino commits to accelerate action
to remove all legal social and economic
barriers to achieving gender equality
and the empowerment of all women and
girls we support the empowerment of
other vulnerable groups such as Youth
and people with disability aiming at the
realization of and full enjoyment of
their human rights for submarine it is
essential to continue to work for an
inclusive and Equitable quality
education including early childhood
education digital education and stress
the importance of addressing the gender
gap in education in this regard we
welcome the outcomes of 2022 United
Nations transforming education Summit
San Marino calls on all members stay to
spread the benefit of digitalization by
expanding the participation of all
countries in particular developing
countries in the digital economy
we also believe
extremely important to accelerate the
transition to sustainable food system
and promote healthy nutrition diets and
consumption practices and to recover
momentum and accelerate efforts to end
anger and all form of malnutrition in
this respect we welcome the outcome of
the 2023 U.N Food Systems to take in
moment which served as the first Global
follow-up to the 2021 food system Summit
moreover as promoter of the resolution
which established the 29th of September
as International Day of awareness and
full of food loss and Waste San Marino
firmly believes that fight
against food loss and waste will
contribute to promote food security and
welcomes all the initiatives aiming at
developing awareness in such responsible
behaviors
in conclusion Mr President if you want
to be the inclusive Equitable and
peaceful Society it is essential to find
new ways of working together and to
ensure that multilateral institutions
will be able to address the rapid
changes taking place
member states must assume their
responsibilities including that of
making our organization able to fulfill
its mandate which is to protect the
citizens of the world thanks to its
Century old history of Peace and Freedom
samarina is a state with a strong
vocation to dialogue and solidarity our
state is small but proud to bring its
contribution to the work of the United
Nations thank you
thank you
[Applause]
I thank the chair of the delegation of
San Marino
